greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array T read by diagonals: T(i,j)=least number of knight's moves on a chessboard (infinite in all directions) needed to move from (0,0) to (i,j).
comment: For number of knight's moves to various subsets of the chessboard, see A018837, A183041 - A183053.
formula: Cases 1-4 determine T in the 1st quadrant;
all other T(i,j) are easily obtained by symmetry.
example: Corner of the array, T(i,j) for i>=0, k>=0:
xref: Identical to A049604 except for T(1, 1).
results.author: _Stewart Gordon_, Dec 05 2001
ext: Formula, examples, and comments by _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 20 2010
